result.execSummary:
All charges against Derrick L Wright in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Derrick L Wright is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Per SCR 72, documents have been optically imaged and file destroyed.
Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.

Assessment for attorney fees and cost in the amount of $570.00 entered as ordered by the court on 4/16/22  to pay $50.00 monthly. Final payment due by 04/01/2020, Failure to pay is a civil judgement. lj

Affidavit and order for payment of attorney fees and costs due from Milwaukee County signed.  Filed by:
VALDEZ $560
Affidavit and Order for Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs Due from Milwaukee County, signed and filed.
Cash bail refund check packet. Check Issued 03/29/19. er

Defendant Derrick L Wright in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Elizabeth N Larson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for jury trial.  State's essential witness failed to appear.  State has no alternative theory of prosecution.  Defense motion to DISMISS is granted by the Court WITHOUT PREJUDICE.

Defendant Derrick L Wright in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HELD OFF THE RECORD AS COURT WAS IN TRIAL ON ANOTHER MATTER. Parties remains in trial posture. Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 03-20-2019 at 8:30 a.m. in Br 45.
DEFENSE'S MOTION IN LIMINE

Defendant Derrick L Wright in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case in Court for a Pre-Trial Conference. HELD OFF THE RECORD. Defense counsel has received discovery and offer. Defense counsel requests Jury Trial date. Any and all motions are to be filed with the court by the final pretrial date. Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference and Jury Trial in Branch 5.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 24, 2019 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for March 20, 2019 at 08:30 am.
-From the state; Received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
-Received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Derrick L Wright in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Elizabeth N Larson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD. Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for pretrial conference.   Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 05.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 7, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Derrick L Wright in court pro-se.  Joshua D. Taggatz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for Pretrial conference. For reasons stated on the record, defendant is not public defender eligible. Indigency hearing proceeded.  Based upon the defendant's statements, the court found the defendant eligible for appointment of counsel at county expense.  The court appointed Attorney Ramon Valdez to represent the defendant; counsel to be paid at the rate of $70.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant to repay Milwaukee County for attorney fees at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing at the close of the case.  Failure to make timely payments according to the imposed payment schedule may result in a civil judgment, subject to tax intercept. Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense signed and filed.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 20, 2018 at 08:30 am.
Bail Refund packet, Check issued October 30th, 2018
Court orders $550.00 bail to be returned.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with T.R.R.

Defendant Derrick L Wright in court. Student Intern Michelle Grasso under the supervision of Assistant District Attorney Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kuhnmuench, Branch 05. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 05.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 6, 2018 at 08:30 am.
Initial appearance on October 18, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Derrick L Wright not in court.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
He posted bail on 10-1-2018 with the county jail they gave him the wrong room to go to. I checked with the DA's office and they informed me that he did not show up there. 
Defendant having failed to appear, Court ordered a summons for the defendant returnable in Br. OCCR on 10-18-2018, at 1:30 pm. Rm. 221.  Initial appearance scheduled for October 18, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
